page.title: 14Pencombe and Employment
page.content: In our area, which takes in roughly half the village, there are 72 people in employment including farmers wives actively involved in their farms and some women working part-time. Of these 72, 40 are working locally, ie within 3m of their homes and nearly all 40 in farming apart from the pub landlord, school secretary etc. There are 32 people who commute to work in a town or city, mostly to Bromyard, Ledbury, Leominster, Hereford or Worcester. Of the 72 employed, 11 are working at a job dependent on farming from contractors doing hedge-trimming, fencing, spraying etc.to people working for firms making or servicing farm equipment. Others are marketing fruit and vegetables grown locally. This does not take into account people mainly women,who work at seasonal jobs such as hoptying, and fruit picking.
